intro: Hieracium kopsicum, commonly known as the Kopsic hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium kopsicum is known for its ability to thrive in various environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
